Package es.udc.redes.webserver

Class ServerThread

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
es.udc.redes.webserver.ServerThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
Class responsible for receiving the HTTP request and creating a new 'HTTPResponse' object which will handle that request.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Object accessMutex
    Mutex to control the writes in the 'accessLog.log'.
    private java.lang.Object errorMutex
    Mutex to control the writes in the 'errorLog.log'.
    private java.util.Properties properties
    Different server properties specified in 'server.properties' such as the default file or the default directory.
    private java.net.Socket socket
    Socket in which we are going to receive data.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void run()
    Method launched when a thread starts; it uses a BufferedReader to read all the request data, analyzing at the same time if an 'If-Modified-Since' header is present.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerThread

      public ServerThread​(java.net.Socket s, java.util.Properties properties, java.lang.Object accessMutex, java.lang.Object errorMutex)
      Parameters:
      s - Socket in which we are going to receive data.
      properties - Different server properties specified in 'server.properties' such as the default file or the default directory.
      accessMutex - Mutex to control the writes in the 'accessLog.log'.
      errorMutex - Mutex to control the writes in the 'errorLog.log'.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Method launched when a thread starts; it uses a BufferedReader to read all the request data, analyzing at the same time if an 'If-Modified-Since' header is present. The request received is printed in the stdout and the 'HTTPResponse' response method is called.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread
